page.title: 12CHURCHES IN HARPUR HILL
page.content: There are two churches in Harpur Hill both near the centre of the village The{Methodist church}is part of the Queen's Road, Fairfield church.There is a weekly Sunday School and a family service on the first Sunday of the month. They have a morning service April to October and in the afternoon for the rest of the year. {St James' church}was built in{1910}as a daughter church of the Burbage Parish and would have been looked after by a curate. Now it is part of a team ministry also based on Burbage Church. The team is led by the{Rev. {John Tomlinson,}rector since 1984. Holy Communion(9am) & Evensong(6pm) are held on Sundays and there is a Holy Communion service on Wednesday morning too. There is an old churchyard opposite the church.
